intro: Cassebeeria fordii, commonly known as the Ford's cassebeer, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, pink to red flowers that bloom in late spring. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Due to its limited range and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
